data.title: Stopped for a Pint
data.text:
A sneaky, convenient location for libation! 
From the second we started our conversation with Maria, we knew we were in for a real treat! This place has all the evidence of a real good time! Maria was a wealth of information regarding Waterline's product and of the area all around Wilmington.
The Scottish ale and the Coffee and Cream were absolutely delicious!

data.title: OctoberFest
data.text: Enjoyed a great time with co-workers @ the first OctoberFest.  I'm not much of a beer drinker, but really did enjoy two Ace Pumpkin Hard Cider.  There were two food trucks and LOTS of people.  Great place to "hang out."

data.title: Super cool place good beer
data.text: We stopped here for the first time yesterday.  Nice big space with games, live music, food truck,  and people. The beer we had was good, not my personal favorite brewery but good none the less. I like checking out the beer handles and I liked theirs-simple and colorful.

data.title: Good beer selections
data.text: Great renovations in this old furniture factory.  Have to add it to your brewery tour in Wilmington. Friendly staff and good beer flights.

data.title: Mmmmm, Beer!
data.text:
The good news is you can find their beer in some local restaurants, so you don't *have* to go to the Brewery. The bad news is you'll need to arrange a driver in any event because they make some downright delicious beer! The stout is smooth, rich, flavorful, and clean. No tongue-coating, palette heaviness here. As quaffable a stout as I think I've ever tasted. The kolsch is as it should be. Light, crisp, and refreshing, straightforward with no bite or bitterness. Enough body to show you it's real beer, but dangerously drinkable to the point that I think if you had nothing but this you would find yourself curled up under the table quite by surprise. They produce a not-quite-IPA (in my opinion) red ale for the local Fox & Hound which I find absolutely amazing. You get all of the floral, fruity aromas of some amazing hops, with a deep flavor profile. It's crisp and clean (do you see a pattern here?) but at the point that you expect the hops to clamp down on your tongue and make your heart skip a beat you're left with a long, pleasant finish. If you're not a particular fan of IPAs (I'm not) you'll probably find yourself a bit puzzled as you take a second and third sip and attempt to figure out what just happened. By the time you're halfway through the pint you will relax and start to enjoy the novel concept of enjoying a heavy load of hops without being offended by the bitterness and bite that usually comes along for the ride. The hefeweizen is well made, but VERY sweet. We actually cut it with a bit of "regular" IPA to tone it down a bit. While it was a good beer, it is not a particular favorite of mine.

In any event, if you're a fan of beer then you need to keep an eye peeled for Waterline or make plans to visit them. You won't be disappointed.

data.title: Very Good Beer; Good Atmosphere
data.text: So, this is a brewery, not an eatery.  And the beer they brew is very good (and I'm not a big beer drinker).  They also serve many other bottled beers and some wine; no hard liquor.  They do serve snacks but no food, except when the food trucks show up.  So if you're hungry, you might want to call ahead to see when the food truck will be there.  There service is quite friendly and the beer is very reasonably priced.  Parking is easy too, unlike downtown.

data.title: Live music
data.text: Excellent place to listen to live music on the weekends. Schedule varies so check out Facebook or website. The beer garden is a fun outside space with corn hole, picnic tables, and weekend food trucks. The sunsets are breath taking!

data.title: Was expecting more
data.text: Wilmington has gotten a lot of new microbreweries in the last couple years.  This is the newest one and I had been looking forward to visiting it.  Gracious hostess, nice tasting area with outside views from the parking lot of the Cape Fear river.  The beer however was just average.  Had the Stout which was on the light side and the Kolch which is a light beer from the get go.  The stout was okay, but not as hefty as I like and the Kolch was quite good.  Although it was not as good as I anticipated, my expectations may have been a little too high.  Will go back for a second opinion in the near future and sit outside with a view of the river.

data.title: Visiting local breweries
data.text:
We heard about waterline from another brewery and we were told to check out their beer. Glad we did!
Excellent beers had a couple flights and alot of the rye ipa my favorite.
One of the owners Rob eas very nice and informative about beers. Kelsey one of the beertenders was very nice and helpful. Place is very clean and i have to say some of the best beets on the east coast.

data.title: Great find!
data.text: We went on ribbon cutting day and were greeted by one of the owners. The location makes you a little unsure of what you are walking into.... But think of it as a hidden treasure. There is ample seating near the bar and a nice set-up in the live music area. All four of us got flights, and the beer was good nothing too bitter! Of course we got follow-up pints.  We've been to several breweries in Wilmington and Waterline is in a tie for number one!

data.title: Great beer and fantasic brewmiester
data.text: I have know the co-owners for quite a few years and their combined brewing experience is over the top.  The variety and atmosphere is worth making time to visit their new place.  They put a lot of heart and sole into everything.  Wishing them all of the best!!!

data.title: Awesome destination!
data.text: This brewery is amazing from the beer, which is wonderful, to the bar, which is truly unique. I heard about this it from the Luna Caffe earlier in the day, so my girlfriend and I went there for drinks after diner. A passionate staff offered great service and good conversation. It's built into an old warehouse under the Cape Fear Memorial Bridge, making it an awesome destination. It was a quick and easy drive from Leland where we were staying for the week. Cannot wait to go back!!!

data.title: Great New Brewery!
data.text: Waterline Brewing is a new addition to the outskirts of downtown Wilmington, located by the bridge.  They offer both their own beers and guest brews, as well as having snacks from the Veggie Wagon and visiting food trucks.  Their beer was good - I enjoyed the stout in particular.  The staff is very friendly, and the interior is comfortable and well appointed.  Great addition to Wilmington's growing beer scene!
